intro: Ceratanthus calcaratus, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ceratanthus calcaratus is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
